advancedchat.config.tab.info.findtype:
How matches will be found
§6Literal §r- Matches §6exactly §rthe string
§eUpper-Lower §r- Like §6Literal, §rbut not §6case-sensitive
§bRegEx §r - Parses the string as a §6regular expression

advancedchat.config.filter.name: Filter Name
advancedchat.config.filter.info.name:
What the filter shows up as §6in the config§r
 §7§bIt is good practice to name your filters meaningfully!
advancedchat.config.filter.info.findstri: The string that will be §6searached§r and §6filtered§r
advancedchat.config.filter.info.findtype:
How matches will be found
§6Literal §r- Matches §6exactly §rthe string
§eUpper-Lower §r- Like §6Literal, §rbut not §6case-sensitive
§bRegEx §r - Parses the string as a §6regular expression
§dAll §r- Passes §6all §rtext through the filter, regardless of the string to find. This option is mainly used if you want to use a parent filter soley for grouping several child filters
advancedchat.config.filter.info.replacet:
The string that §6replaces §rwhat is set for §6replace type §r
§b%MATCH% is replaced by whatever §6triggered§r the filter

How the filter should replace the matched message 
§eOnly Match §r- Replaces only what §6triggered §rthe filter 
§6Full Message §r- Replaces the full message with the §6replace to§r string 
§dChildren §r- Passes the §6matched string§r to be modified by §6child filters 
§cNone §r - Replaces §6nothing

advancedchat.config.filter.info.soundpit: How §6high or low§r the notification sound is. Equivalent to the §6pitch§r argument when using /playsound
